result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 8:50 a.m.  Attorney Richard Joseph Smith in court.   Defendant Jose F Aguirre Gaviria did not appear.   Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter. Attorney Smith states he does not know why Defendant does not appear today.  Court issues a capias-Br. 4 only. Bail is ordered revoked and forfeited. Defendant Jose F Aguirre Gaviria in court with attorney Richard J. Smith.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Patrick Ryan sworn-in and appears as spanish Interpreter. Defendant Jose F Aguirre Gaviria in court with attorney Richard J. Smith and Michael Reyes.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter. Detective Andrew Jicha was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects to bind over and presents arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Interpreter available for next scheduled hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
